title: Meghan Markle wears high street camel trench dress, copy her look here for less
text:

On the penultimate day of the Royal Tour, Meghan opted for a classic trench dress to attend The Association of Commonwealth Universities at the University of Johannesburg in South Africa.

The double breasted dress shape that's belted at the middle is one of the Duchess's preferred dress shapes, and today Meghan stepped out in a knee length camel version.

Meghan's dress exact dress is from Banana Republic, and is available to buy here for £95.

The Duchess chose to style her Banana Republic dress with her Stuart Weitztman 'Legend' pumps in Haze Beige, another style favourite of Meghan's.

Perhaps Meghan has adopted this dress style as her signature look as it's such a flattering shape, the double breasted style skims over any problem areas and the belted middle ensures she is cinched in at the waist.

Either way, we think she looks fantastic and we love how she doesn't feel pressure to try something new, as this is clearly what Meghan feels most comfortable in, both before and after baby.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

We've seen Meghan opt for this style of dress before, for her first public appearance after the birth of baby Archie, the Duchess wore a white midi length trench style dress...

(Image: PA Wire/PA Images)

Last year Meghan opted for another trench midi dress, this time in blush pink.

(Image: Doug Peters/EMPICS)

It's clear that this look is a style favourite for Meghan, and is sure to continue to be a major trend going forward.
